channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Johnny Depp's assistant reveals the moment actor divorced Amber Heard
item.description: Kevin Murphy, who worked for Depp for nearly eight years until 2016, said in a statement to the High Court in London that he received a phone call from the couple on the evening of May 21 that year.

item.title: Maurice Roëves dead: Doctor Who and EastEnders star dies aged 83
item.description: The Scottish actor (pictured with Phil Mitchell in Eastenders), who was born in Sunderland, was confirmed to have passed away by acting agents Lovett Logan Associates.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 100k sell homemade soft porn during lockdown
item.description: New OnlyFans.com accounts in the UK are up 42 per cent since lockdown began in early March while rival AdmireMe saw its numbers go up a third almost overnight.

item.title: £3bn Ethiopian dam across Blue Nile causes Egypt tensions
item.description: Ethiopia has bet its future on a dam across the Blue Nile river which was due to start filling this month, but downstream neighbour Egypt fears it could cut off its supply and may resort to force to stop it.

item.title: Massive blaze rips through Iranian port near nuclear power station as seven ships burn
item.description: Dramatic video purporting to show the blaze shows thick black smoke billowing from the scene at the port of Bushehr - as men desperately tried to put out the flames.

item.title: FIFA confirm the 2022 World Cup final will be held just SEVEN DAYS before Christmas
item.description: It means one team - potentially Gareth Southgate's England side - will have the dream early Christmas present by hoisting the Jules Rimet trophy aloft.

item.title: Coronavirus Norway: Low death rate means funeral homes struggle
item.description: Undertakers in Norway say the lockdown has also led to fewer deaths from other diseases, meaning that 'old and sick people' who 'would have died in normal circumstances' are still alive.

item.title: Amazon shoppers spot bag for sale containing 'photo of a child with tape over its mouth'
item.description: Amazon shoppers have flooded the retailer with complaints after apparently spotting a Dallas Cowboys sports bag containing a photo of 'a child with tape over its mouth' on Tuesday.

item.title: Hopes build over UK Covid vaccine as Oxford drug trials work
item.description: The team of scientists in Oxford have already said they are '80 per cent' confident they can have a jab available by September with more good news expected this week.

item.title: Andrew Neil show is AXED as BBC News announces a further 70 job cuts due to coronavirus
item.description: The BBC today revealed The Andrew Neil Show will end as it slashes a further 70 jobs in BBC News, taking the total number of redundancies to 520.

item.title: Manhattan tech millionaire's murder was 'financially' motivated
item.description: Saleh's sister arrived at his apartment on East Houston in Manhattan's Lower East Side on Tuesday afternoon and found her brother's remains in plastic bags.

item.title: Couple reveal how they transformed their derelict home in 18 months with no professional help
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Jaime Craven, 29, and her husband Jack, 28, bought the Staffordshire property for £295,000 and estimate the family home will be worth £600,00 once the makeover is complete.

item.title: Emmerdale: Paula Tilbrook, who played Betty Eagleton, dies at 89
item.description: Emmerdale actress Paula Tilbrook has passed away aged 89.The soap legend was best known for playing show regular Betty Eagleston on the long-running ITV programme for 21 years from 1994.

item.title: Woman orders hat from ASOS - but is stunned when she can't get through the DOOR wearing it
item.description: Twitter user Kate Elizabeth offered a cautionary tale on buying online in her video showing her wearing the £11 summer hat from ASOS, which left her 'looking like a mushroom'

item.title: Hong Kong man beats McDonald's worker for face mask reminder
item.description: Viral footage allegedly shows the furious customer throwing punches at the male employee before pushing him to the ground and repeatedly kicking him at a McDonald's in Hong Kong.

item.title: Nick Cannon dropped by ViacomCBS for failing 'to apologize' for using anti-Semitism rhetoric
item.description: In his recent video with Richard 'Professor Griff' Griffin, Nick Cannon referenced deeply offensive conspiracy theories and rhetoric about the Jewish community.

item.title: Government advice leaflet shows man with 'useless' face mask
item.description: Yesterday Number 10 shared a tweet explaining that face masks will become compulsory in shops in England from July 24 - but the graphic showed a man wearing a mask with a valve.

item.title: China accuses Britain of colluding with the US to 'discriminate' against Huawei
item.description: Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden announced yesterday that telecoms firms will be prohibited from buying Huawei 5G equipment from December 31 this year.

item.title: Edward Colston statue is replaced by unofficial sculpture of Black Lives Matter protester
item.description: Edward Colston's empty spot was filled with a monument to Jen Reid - who was photographed on the plinth in Bristol with her fist raised after Colston's monument was torn down.

item.title: Amber Heard 'IGNORED warnings that it was illegal to smuggle her dogs into Australia'
item.description: Kevin Murphy, who worked for Depp for nearly eight years, said Amber Heard 'demanded' he make a false statement about the animals being 'smuggled' into Australia in 2015.

item.title: Who needs a fake ID! Teenagers dress up as senior citizens with face masks to buy alcohol
item.description: TikTok videos show American teens putting powder in their hair and changing their clothes to make themselves appear older before heading out to the liquor store with friends.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell secretly MARRIED: spouse's identity unknown
item.description: The revelation came as dead multi-millionaire Jeffrey Epstein's ex-girlfriend pleaded not guilty on Tuesday in New York via video link to charges related to his sex trafficking ring.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Rodent infestations surge during lockdown
item.description: Data provided to insurance company Aviva by JG Pest Control found a 120 per cent increase in rodent-related call-outs in the UK from March to June compared with the same period in 2019.

item.title: Cancer patients' families slam alternative clinics as relatives die
item.description: Lorna Halliday, a senior scientist at Cambridge University, shares her mother's story on BBC Three's False Hope? Alternative Cancer Cures, along with the family of Liverpudlian Sean Walsh.

item.title: Winona Ryder to take the stand at Johnny Depp's libel trial
item.description: Johnny Depp is suing The Sun's publisher over an April 2018 article which alleged he was violent towards ex-wife Amber Heard, and his former fiancée Winona Ryder is set to give evidence today.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Pendle in Lancashire at risk of local lockdown
item.description: The director of public health for Lancashire, Dr Sakthi Karunanithi, has told residents 'We need your help now to... keep Pendle out of lockdown' as councils see evidence of spread inside households.

item.title: Crane drops homeowner's new £5,000 hot tub 60ft into garden
item.description: The hot tub was being delivered in Swansea, Wales, when disaster struck. A woman can be heard screaming in the video barely seconds before it falls. No one was injured.

item.title: Space to be a battleground in future wars, says Ben Wallace
item.description: In a speech on air and space power in the 'age of constant competition' Ben Wallace said China and Russia were already developing space-based weapons.

item.title: Zoom unveils $600 video conferencing device for home workers
item.description: The US firm is taking advantage of a huge boom in users of its video-conferencing software during the coronavirus pandemic with its first ever physical product.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 24 new fatalities in preliminary death toll
item.description: Department of Health chiefs have yet to confirm the final daily figure, which is often much higher because it takes into account lab-confirmed fatalities in all settings.

item.title: Burberry signals plan to lay off 500 workers as UK's coronavirus redundancies surge towards 63,000
item.description: Luxury fashion firm Burberry, which employs over 1,000, said that retail sales plunged 45 per cent in the three months to June 27 due to lockdown closing stores in the UK.

item.title: Bodycam video shows moment deputy shoots dead stabbing suspect
item.description: Law enforcement authorities in Michigan have released surveillance and body camera recordings showing the fatal shooting of stabbing suspect Sean Ruis, 43, at the hands of a deputy.

item.title: Daisy Lowe's new boyfriend named as animal-lover Jordan Saul
item.description: Daisy, 31, was spotted kissing hunky Jordan on Saturday in a north London park. It was the third male companion the model has been spotted with since the beginning of lockdown.

item.title: Priti Patel's GIANT mug causes a stir on Twitter
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel has caused a frenzy on Twitter as she was pictured drinking out of an enormous mug during the Home Affairs Committee remote hearing today.

item.title: Italian cop recalls moment knife was pulled by US student, murder trial hears
item.description: Finnegan Lee Elder, 20, and Gabriel Natale-Hjorth, 19, allege they were attacked by the policemen from behind in Rome, and defended themselves from what they believed to be dangerous drug dealers.

item.title: Sister of woman who was brutally murdered on her father's orders speaks out against forced marriage
item.description: Payzee Mahmod, the sister of Banaz Mahmod, 20, an Iraqi Kurd from Mitcham, south London, who was raped and killed in 2006 on her father's orders, has spoken out against forced marriage.

item.title: Video of David Walliams humiliating young men by pulling down their pants on stage
item.description: The clip is from a BBC documentary featuring Little Britain in Australia in 2007. Walliams, now 48, plays a predatory gay ex-kids' TV entertainer called Des Kaye, who invites young men onto the stage

item.title: Gangs stab each other in knife fight at Nike store - as five thugs are jailed for total of ten years
item.description: Five men have been jailed for a total of ten years and four months on July 14 after a vicious knife fight broke out at a Nike store in Resorts World shopping centre in Birmingham last year.

item.title: Face masks may have to be worn in ALL public places including offices and other workplaces
item.description: Downing Street added to the bafflement by indicating that sandwich shops will not be covered, as the system would only apply in 'shops and supermarkets' after July 24.

item.title: Boy, 15, gets 18 months' detention for swinging machete at rival
item.description: A 15-year-old boy has been sent to a young offenders institute for 18 months for his role in a 'reckless and dangerous' cinema brawl in Birmingham last November.

item.title: Magaluf's party strip closed after yobs jumped on cars
item.description: Magaluf's notorious party strip has been closed after boozed-up British yobs were filmed jumping on cars, as Ibiza streets are pictured lying eerily empty amid a sharp drop in tourism due to Covid-19.

item.title: McDonald's will slash prices on Big Macs, Chicken McNuggets and Happy Meals from TODAY
item.description: Chicken McNuggets, Happy Meals and the Quarter Pounder with Cheese are set to come down in price across Britain after Rishi Sunak slashed VAT from 20 per cent to 5 per cent.

item.title: Colonel Tom Moore says it will be 'the most special of days' when Queen knights him on Friday
item.description: Colonel Tom Moore, who raised the funds by walking laps of his garden, will travel to the Berkshire royal residence with members of his family for the rare investiture with the monarch on Friday.

item.title: Nigel Farage is accused of breaking social distancing again
item.description: Furious locals in Cornwall have hit out at the leader of the Brexit Party, claiming he didn't follow any of the government's rules during the trip.

item.title: Increase in 'invasive' species as a result of human activity could lead to global biodiversity loss
item.description: An international team of experts led from Austria collated data from 36 specialists in biological invasions to identify key causes and likely impacts on future biodiversity.

item.title: Man 'brutally' murdered disabled neighbour over dog, court told
item.description: Raymond Burrell, 43, subjected Matthew Sheehan, 36, to a 'merciless' attack in Adamstown, Cardiff in September 2015.

item.title: Abigail Shrier says parents are gagged by PC culture:'Transgender Craze Seducing Our Daughters'
item.description: Abigail Shrier, from LA, author of Irreversible Damage: The Transgender Craze Seducing Our Daughters, told the Woman By Definition Podcast that progressive efforts have backfired.

item.title: BofE: UK economy set for 'incomplete V-shaped' recovery
item.description: The UK economy is set for an 'incomplete V-shaped' recovery from the coronavirus crisis, according to a Bank of England policymaker.

item.title: Pensioner uses his electric buggy to tow boat from marina
item.description: A pensioner was filmed helping out mariners on the Isle of Wight on Saturday. The funny footage shows his mobility scooter towing a boat out of Ryde Marina followed by three men.

item.title: World War II Enigma machine goes up for sale for £16,000
item.description: The Enigma I device was hidden in a 3ft hole 120 miles from Berlin and remained there for decades until it was found by a treasure hunter near the village of Sülstorf.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Borrowers to get help if they can't pay
item.description: The measures, introduced by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), a regulatory body in the UK, were previously subject to a consultation. The guidance will come into force on Friday.

item.title: Boris Johnson admits jobs WILL be lost after watchdog warned of 4m unemployed
item.description: Boris Johnson said 'no-one should underestimate the challenges' the UK faces after the government's watchdog warned four million people could be on the dole queue by next year.

item.title: Women's rugby star Non Evans announces she's gay on Twitter
item.description: Former rugby star Non Evans has revealed she is gay in a confessional post on Twitter. The Swansea-born sporting icon apologised for taking years but has been met with great support

item.title: Kebab-carrying drunk man climbs ladder to break into his home
item.description: Reece Barr, 25, from Leeds, came home from a drunken night out to discover he had forgotten his keys. He climbed a 20-foot ladder and smashed his bedroom window to get inside.

item.title: Mary Trump says family knows Donald cheated on 1964 SATs
item.description: President Trump's niece Mary said she's 'absolutely confident' that the president cheated on his SATs and said other Trump family members know the story is true.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson promises independent enquiry
item.description: After weeks of dodging an explicit commitment, Boris Johnson told the House of Commons that an independent probe will 'certainly' take place.

item.title: UK's 20 most Instagrammable villages revealed based on hashtags
item.description: The list has been compiled by assessing the number of hashtags for 100 villages dotted around the UK. The top 20 ranking shows the hamlets that have been hashtagged the most.

item.title: Matt Hancock admits he is 'worried' about Covid-19's 'debilitating' effects
item.description: A significant number of British Covid-19 patients have reported suffering chronic tiredness, breathlessness and heart problems for months after beating the disease.

item.title: How opportunists are snapping up normally hard-to-get tables at the nation's swankiest restaurants
item.description: FEMAIL searched for reservations in the next few weeks at some of the country's most famous restaurants - including Michel Roux Jr's Le Gavroche in Mayfair and Mana in Manchester.

item.title: Prince Andrew smiles on day Ghislaine Maxwell appears in court
item.description: The Duke of York was laughing uproariously with his bodyguard as he drove out of the gates of Windsor Castle this morning where he has been keeping a low profile at his lodge in the Queen's estate.

item.title: Ali Hewson has penned a letter BLASTING construction plans
item.description: In a letter to Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council, Bono's wife Ali Hewson said the fence erected on Killiney strand in South Dublin is impeding her family's access to the beach.

item.title: Amber Heard and girlfriend Bianca Butti go shopping after a day in court
item.description: Amber Heard indulged in a spot of retail therapy in London after spending another day fighting her estranged husband in court yesterday.

item.title: Suspect in the murder of Tottenham defender Serge Aurier's brother hands himself in to police
item.description: Christopher Aurier, 26, was fatally wounded in the early hours of Monday after being shot in Toulouse outside a nightclub and he was pronounced dead in hospital.

item.title: Up to 90 more migrants are caught trying to get to UK
item.description: As many as 90 people are thought to have been detained and they were pictured being brought into the harbour at the Port of Dover in Kent this morning.

item.title: Man, 82, catches coronavirus TWICE in two months
item.description: Doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital (pictured) revealed the case of the old man who, against the odds, managed to beat the virus twice despite ending up in intensive care both times.

item.title: Shocking Emergency Calls UK: Viewers left 'shaking' after hearing story of Alice Ruggles
item.description: In last night's Shocking Emergency Calls UK, Maxine McGill, recalled the 'deathly silence' as she entered the flat she shared with friend Alice Ruggles in Gateshead - before discovering her dead body.

item.title: New hope for rare British horse breed after scientists breed a filly whose sex was selected in a lab
item.description: Only 72 Suffolk Punch mare presently remain in the United Kingdom - and less than 300 across the entire globe - meaning every filly born is vital to their survival.

item.title: Priti Patel says 50,000 people per day are coming into the UK from abroad
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel revealed the figures as she was grilled by MPs on the government's quarantine arrangements.

item.title: A fifth of Britons use emojis when messaging a love interest
item.description: Uswitch surveyed 2,000 Britons ranging in age from 16-year-olds to pensioners and found women are more likely to use emojis in a conversation than men.

item.title: Brazen drug runners land their boat on a Spanish beach before unloading 'sacks of marijuana'
item.description: In broad daylight, half a dozen men dressed in black offloaded drugs from a speedboat at a Costa del Sol beach by a residential area called Benamara between Marbella and Estepona.

item.title: Death Valley sets record for the planet's hottest temperature in years as it reaches 128F
item.description: Death Valley's weather station recorded an official high temperature of 128F on Sunday afternoon. A photo posted by the Park Service showed their thermometer to be even higher at 129F.

item.title: Parents detail what life is like with 14 CHILDREN in new TLC reality series
item.description: Karen and Deon Derrico are getting ready to welcome triplets while raising their 11 children in their new reality series Doubling Down with the Derricos.

item.title: German court bans Tesla adverts referencing its Autopilot self-driving system
item.description: Tesla can appeal the ruling, which will remove all ads referencing the capabilities of its Autopilot feature in the country where Elon Musk intends to set up shop in Europe with a new Gigafactory.

item.title: Tube worker 'accidentally' scrubbed off Banksy's £1.5m sneezing rats
item.description: The guerrilla artist, dressed in a boiler suit, goggles and face mask, painted a rat sneezing green paint across the carriage's window and walls to encourage people to cover their faces.

item.title: Nissan's Ariya is a spaceship-inspired electric SUV with a 310-mile range
item.description: With its bold looks, low roofline, big grille, and razor thin sci-fi looking LED lights, the Ariya puts itself against other plug-in SUV models like the Tesla Model X, Jaguar I-Pace and Mercedes EQC.

item.title: BBC documentary delves into Murdoch's real-life Succession battle
item.description: BBC2's The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty, which aired on Tuesday, charted the rise of media mogul Rupert Murdoch and the battle to inherit his empire between children Lachlan, James and Elisabeth.

item.title: Jet2 restarts flights and holidays for the first time in four months today
item.description: Jet2.com is set to launch 50 flights today as it returns to its normal service for the first time in nearly four months. The airline serves countries including Greece (inset), Spain, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Johnny Depp wrapped his shirt around Amber Heard's neck, court hears
item.description: Amber Heard wrote in her diary while aboard the Orient Express on July 27, 2015: 'Our fight was terrible. J at one point found himself with his shirt wrapped around my neck. He hit me several times.'

item.title: Moment thief hammers lock in bid to steal NHS workers bike
item.description: The two men filmed stealing bikes at the Royal Victoria Infirmary, Newcastle, have been arrested, said Northumbria Police. They stole the bikes as NHS workers fought to save lives.

item.title: Beauty experts reveal the TikTok hacks you should and should NOT be trying
item.description: Experienced health and beauty experts, all based in the UK, reveal the dos and don'ts of some of the trending at-home tutorials on TikTok - and the best products for recreating at home.

item.title: Tom Hanks describes his COVID-19 symptoms as 'bones feeling like they were made of crackers'
item.description: Tom Hanks has revealed he had 'bone crushing fatigue' during his battle with COVID-19 in March.

item.title: Arsenal Fan TV chief Robbie Lyle apologises for 'derogatory remark' made by contributor
item.description: Callegari was heard to say 'DVD's going off' when the South Korean was substituted in the 94th-minute of Tottenham's 2-1 win. The racist term has been directed at Son in the past.

item.title: Rate of Covid-19 infection in England dropped in May BEFORE lockdown restrictions were lifted
item.description: More than 120,000 volunteers were tested across England. Every infected person was passing the virus on to 0.57 people during May.

item.title: Rise in drink-driving deaths comes as police carry out fewer breathalyser tests
item.description: The report, due to be published tomorrow, was commissioned by the Department of Transport amid fears that road safety has been compromised by traffic police cuts.

item.title: Apple wins EU court battle over order to pay £12billion in back taxes
item.description: The European Commission claimed Apple paid an effective corporate tax rate of just 1 per cent on profits from sales made across the EU by routing them through a firm based in Ireland.

item.title: Masks and Mickey: Disneyland Paris reopens after four-month closure
item.description: The Paris theme park closed on March 12 as coronavirus spiralled out of control in Europe, but began its 'phased re-opening' today with visitor numbers limited by an online reservation system.

item.title: Spotify launches two new trending podcast charts
item.description: The 'Trending' and 'Top' Podcasts charts respectively showcase the biggest-moving and most popular podcasts, based on a user's region.

item.title: Two people are in critical condition after stabbing spree in Norway
item.description: Two women were left in critical condition and a third was stabbed in the arm after being attacked by a man in Sarpsborg, Norway, around midnight - with one victim later dying of her injuries.

item.title: Germany vulnerable to second wave of Covid-19 as antibody study reveals only 1.3% has immunity
item.description: The Robert Koch Institute (RKI), Germany's infectious diseases agency, warned almost everyone in Germany is still at risk of catching the coronavirus.

item.title: Fans swoon over Meghan Markle's flowing hair and glowing skin
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex sent royal fans wild when she debuted a sleek new hairstyle during a live speech at a digital global leadership summit yesterday, appearing from her Los Angeles home.

item.title: Killer is jailed for 12 years following fatal beating of Vietnamese man in South Wales
item.description: Tu Minh Le, 47, was sentenced to 12 years for the killing of 44-year-old Tran Nguyen, who died at the Royal Gwent Hospital in Newport in November 2006.

item.title: Meghan Markle's BFF Misha Nonoo admits she's 'missed her friends'
item.description: Meghan Markle's BFF Misha Nonoo known for her eponymous clothing line, revealed that it was 'very stressful not having your normal life to return to' when speaking to People magazine.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's £800,000 mansion was 'protected by ex-British soldiers funded by her brother'
item.description: Court papers revealed security told FBI officers former British military were working as bodyguards on rotation protecting Ghislaine Maxwell. One was so trusted they had a credit card to buy food

item.title: Kanye West 'bows out of presidential race' after exploring getting his name on Florida ballot
item.description: Rapper Kanye West, 43, has allegedly ended his bid to win the White House after ten days following attempts to get himself on the ballot as a third-party candidate in Florida and several other states.

item.title: World's first private icebreaker with its own deep-sea submarine is launched
item.description: The 253ft long ship called La Datcha was commissioned by Russian billionaire Oleg Tinkov, 52, but is also available as a private charter for the mega rich for £665,000 a week.

item.title: Deliveroo moped rider smashes windscreen of £300k Ferrari F430 after late night London crash
item.description: Police and ambulance crews rushed to the scene in Peckham last night after a Deliveroo moped rider crashed into the £300k Ferrari leaving its windscreen smashed and two people hospitalised.

item.title: Predator loses Supreme Court battle after claiming vigilante paedophile hunters breached his PRIVACY
item.description: Mark Sutherland (pictured), 37, brought a landmark case at the Supreme Court claiming his human rights were breached after he was caught in a sting by a vigilante group.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreaks are up to 20 TIMES more likely in large care homes, study claims
item.description: Edinburgh University researchers examined infection patterns at nearly 200 homes and found the chance of clusters of cases tripled with every additional 20 beds.

item.title: Man, 27, is arrested by police probing the murder of journalist Lyra McKee
item.description: Detectives investigating the murder of of Northern Irish journalist Lyra McKee have arrested a 27-year-old man. Ms McKee, 29, was shot dead in April 2019 as she observed rioting in Londonderry.

item.title: Jeremy Vine has angry stand-off with Fiat 500 driver over box junction
item.description: In the footage filmed by Radio 2 star Jeremy Vine, which has been viewed 66,000 times already, the presenter is heard saying: 'I think you broke the law there' to the male driver after he undertook a car.

item.title: Female champion bodybuilder and former porn star found dead at her home in Cornwall aged 43
item.description: Former international bodybuilder and porn star Joanna Thomas was found dead at her home in Camborne, Cornwall at the age of 43 in April.

item.title: Police release CCTV of woman, 30, who has not seen for three days
item.description: Police have today released a CCTV image of missing 30-year-old Klaudia Jaselska, who vanished from Bristol after she was seen boarding a bus.

item.title: New Orleans bars closed just a month after reopening
item.description: Good times have been put on hold once again on Saturday when Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards issued a set of new restrictions following a new spike in Covid-19 cases and hospitalizations.

item.title: Cruel thug is caught on CCTV putting three cats into washing machines at a laundrette
item.description: A barefooted man was caught on CCTV putting three cats into washing machines at a laundrette in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on July 12. Police arrested a homeless suspect.

item.title: Hundreds of baby crocodiles line up like a tiny army on the banks of a river
item.description: Hundreds of baby crocodiles have been photographed lining up like a tiny army on the banks of a river before taking the plunge in India.

item.title: Hilarious moment a bride and groom plunged into water when posing for pictures at the edge of a dock
item.description: Lora Wendorf, 35, and Jordan Devries, 35, tried to recreate the amorous acrobatics Lora had seen on Dancing With The Stars, but things went very wrong and they tumbled into the river together.

item.title: Paedophile jailed for tricking girl, 13, into sex back behind bars after targeting another girl
item.description: Jordana Davidson was locked up for two and a half years in 2018 after tricking a 13-year-old into having sex with her. After her release, she moved to Liverpool and targeted another young girl.

item.title: Queen banned Prince Charles from buying Australian country retreat, palace letters reveal
item.description: Details of the secret meeting with Prime Minister Gough Whitlam in 1974 were revealed in newly-released letters between Governor-General Sir John Kerr and the Queen's secretary.

item.title: Mother, 21, claims Snapchat selfie is 'proof' her home is haunted after spotting face of old woman
item.description: Chloe Lythgoe, a supermarket worker, was pouting in the bathroom mirror when she took the photo. She claims it proves her home in Warrington, Cheshire, is haunted.

item.title: Moment army of ANTS tries to steal package
item.description: This is the moment an army of ants pick up a package and try to take it to a flowerbed in St Louis, Missouri. It is unclear why they showed an interest in the mail, but it may have contained sugar.

item.title: At least ten children and two staff members catch coronavirus at summer camp in Spain
item.description: Health officials carried out 59 tests, 42 of which were on the children, at the YMCA hostel in Salduero, Soria, after one child fell ill. The children, who came from various regions in Spain, were sent home.

item.title: Rod Stewart, 75, takes extra precautions against COVID-19 as he wears TWO face masks
item.description: Rod Stewart took extra precautions against coronavirus as he donned two face masks en-route to a family dinner in Split with wife Penny Lancaster on Tuesday.

item.title: Hunt for third worker who fled Covid-hit farm where 200 people were forced to isolate on site
item.description: Three 'Eastern European' men fled from Rook Row Farm (pictured, workers' lodgings) in Mathon after 200 people were forced to isolate on the site when 73 workers tested positive for the bug.

item.title: Pretty USELESS Little Thing! Retailer is slammed for selling 'fishnet' mask that offers NO coverage
item.description: Fashion retailer PrettyLittleThing has been mocked on Twitter for selling a Black Diamante Fishnet Mask online, which provides no coverage for the nose or mouth.

item.title: Child abuser is whipped 74 times in Indonesia while wearing face shield
item.description: The victim wore a visor bore the name of BookCabin.com, a website which describes itself as a new Indonesia-based travel company, but it is unclear whether they sponsored the event.

item.title: Scottish barber reopens at midnight as pubs, cinemas and attractions welcome customers
item.description: Hotels, barber shops, tourist attractions and pubs are reopening in Scotland today after months of lockdown. First Minister Nicola Sturgeon said this was the 'highest risk' easing of measures.

item.title: Trump embraces his gray hair amid the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: President Donald Trump's hair looked markedly different Tuesday compared to the famed blonde hairdo he spotted up until the start of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: West Ham star Michail Antonio appeals for help after cyclist on CCTV appears to slash at tyres
item.description: West Ham's star striker Michail Antonio, 30, took to Instagram tonight to warn others to 'watch-out' after his vehicle was targeted in Wapping, East London.

item.title: Townhouse where Lord Mountbatten once entertained guests goes on the market for £19.5million
item.description: The five-storey Regency townhouse, situated in London's exclusive Belgravia neighbourhood, boasts five bedrooms, a private courtyard and access to stunning communal gardens.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals the four most common male sexual problems
item.description: Tracey Cox has tackled the four most common sexual issues that impact men, which may be causing problems in your relationship, including premature ejaculation and inability to orgasm.

item.title: Princess Diana is the most attractive royal of all time according to the Golden Ratio
item.description: Dr De Silva, who runs the Centre For Advanced Facial Cosmetic & Plastic Surgery in London, used the 'golden ratio' formula devised by ancient Greeks to analyse the faces of royal women.

item.title: Doctor arrested for drink driving is declared fit to carry on treating patients
item.description: Lauren Fowler drank white wine with friends over lunch then crashed her Ford Ka in an area busy with pedestrians. The medic was so drunk she was barely able to speak.

item.title: Police officers injured on duty see their pensions under threat
item.description: Disabled and traumatised former officers are being hauled before medical review panels in 'unlawful' attempts to cut their pension packets, campaigners claim.

item.title: Miracle escape of North Carolina man attacked by ALLIGATOR while kayaking
item.description: Peter Joyce was kayaking down the Waccamaw River in North Carolina at the weekend when the terrifying ordeal occurred. He was wearing a camera on his chest and so filmed the charge.

item.title: 'Drunk' British tourist 'coughed on people and told them he had coronavirus' in Spain
item.description: A 43-year-old British man was arrested on Monday night in an upmarket neighbourhood of Palma, Mallorca, after coughing on al-fresco restaurant diners and saying he had coronavirus.

item.title: India sends 375million people back into lockdown
item.description: Health officials announced another 29,429 cases this morning, bringing the total from 906,752 to 936,181 with India on the brink of becoming the third country after the US and Brazil to pile up a million infections.

item.title: Savvy homeowner gives her dull-looking bathroom a Scandi-inspired makeover for just £80
item.description: Jodie Berry, 28, from Neston, Cheshire, used budget materials such as self-adhesive floor tiles and IKEA plants to give her bathroom a whole new lease of life.

item.title: Three-year-old boy is left temporarily 'paralysed' after he was bitten by an ADDER
item.description: Lewis Wise was attacked by a venomous adder at Lightwater Country park in Surrey on Sunday.

item.title: Ex-paratrooper who fought ISIS in Syria after Manchester attack tells of 'heartache' over his arrest
item.description: Daniel Burke, from Wythenshawe, traveled to Syria to fight ISIS in the wake of the Manchester Arena Bombing in May 2017. The former paratrooper had previously fought in Afghanistan.

item.title: The best love match for YOUR star sign: Astrologer reveals the most compatible combinations
item.description: UK-based astrologer Francesca Oddie revealed the best combinations of star signs if you want to build a happy home with your friend, lover, family or flatmate.

item.title: CHOICE issue warning about mixing bleach and vinegar creates 'toxic chlorine gas' in the home
item.description: Australians have been warned of the potential dangers of mixing two common cleaning agents to create a disinfectant for the house.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen blocks 1 MILLION people on Twitter as her account is 'flooded by sick psychopaths'.
item.description: Chrissy Teigen revealed she has blocked more than one million people on Twitter after her account was 'flooded by sick psychopaths'.

item.title: Dr ELIZA FILBY: Not going back to the office will be ruinous for Britain but it's even worse for YOU
item.description: DR ELIZA FILBY: When the Government imposed a three-day working week during the 1973 oil crisis, it feared a productivity drop of at least 40 per cent.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: According to Amanda Owen, who has nine children aged 18 to three, mass motherhood is easy. After you reach the fifth, she says, 'it doesn't matter any more'.

item.title: Donald Trump suggests HE convinced Boris Johnson to ban 'unsafe' Huawei
item.description: Matt Hancock hit out after the US President boasted about Boris Johnson 's U-turn on the Chinese firm, which will see its technology ripped out from most of the telecoms network.

item.title: Mum-of-four shares her genius 'tub' trick for ensuring her house is spotless
item.description: An Australian mother-of-four has shared a clever 'tub' system of cleaning that ensures her house is tidy even with three teenagers underfoot.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg's former personal security chief faces fresh racism allegations
item.description: Liam Booth, a former Secret Service agent who once served in President Barack Obama's personal protection detail, resigned from Zuckerberg's family office in 2019 following a misconduct probe.

item.title: Home cook's mouthwatering recipe for easy slow cooker pulled chicken is shared by thousands
item.description: An Australian home cook has impressed hundreds of others online after sharing how she made a delicious pulled chicken dish in her slow cooker.

item.title: A gender clinic has agreed to help this boy even though he admits he may still change his mind
item.description: Although you could never tell from his photo, Dexter was born a girl, called Talia. At age two, he became convinced he was a boy; at five, he started living as one.

item.title: Personal trainer Sophie Allen reveals the tips everyone losing weight needs to know
item.description: An Australian personal trainer has revealed the 'fat loss basics' everyone trying to lose weight needs to know. Sophie Allen, 30, from Sydney, said there are nine things she swears by for rapid results.

item.title: Holly Branson reveals she 'dressed and peed like a boy' until she was 11'
item.description: Holly Branson has revealed she dressed, peed and 'played' like a boy for almost a decade as a young child, as she thanked her parents for their unconditional love.

item.title: Mum wows the internet with her 'brilliant' trick for reaching hard to reach areas while vacuuming
item.description: An Australian mum has revealed how she uses a bunch of straws to vacuum hard to reach areas around her home. She ties the straws using a rubber band and places it in the nozzle of the vacuum.

item.title: Doctor admits stalking TV explorer Levison wood in a three-month harassment campaign
item.description: Fiza Jabeen, 36, from Harborne in Birmingham, obsessively contacted the former paratrooper on social media despite being handed a restraining order after she contacted his parents and an ex-partner.

item.title: Intruder broke into World's Strongest Man's house
item.description: Eddie Hall, from Newcastle-under-Lyme, was in his hot tub when he noticed the intruder in his garden who challenged 2017's winner of the World's Strongest Man competition to a fight.

item.title: Barclays boss apologises for calling female city financier a 'tart'
item.description: Roger Jenkins (pictured outside the High Court, London) and Richard Boath, discussed Amanda Staveley during a telephone call in October 2008.

item.title: Mass grave of 18 WWII Nazi paratroopers found in Poland
item.description: A mass grave containing the remains of 18 Nazi paratroopers, along with tools and weapons has been found in Poland. The soldiers died at the hands of Stalin's Red Army in 1945.

item.title: Belgian museums row over which mummy inspired TinTin story
item.description: Herge's fictional Inca has sparked a row between rival Belgian tourist attractions, each of which displays a mummy they say inspired Tintin's creator.

item.title: The Big One: Chances of major California earthquake TRIPLE
item.description: Scientists warn the risk of the 'Big One' hitting California's San Andreas fault have tripled after more than 3,000 earthquakes were recorded in the southern region last year.

item.title: Video shows huge ships in head-on crash on Canadian canal
item.description: Disaster struck as the two vessels approached each other in the Welland Canal, a key shipping route that connects Lake Erie and Lake Ontario in Canada.
